instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2914: What is 820-2914? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .
definitions.3V3_SUS: What is 3V3_SUS? 3V3_SUS is an abbreviation for PP3V3_SUS. These are interchangeable. The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PM_SLP_SUS_L:
What is PM_SLP_SUS_L? 
The "PM_SLP_SUS_L" signal in a MacBook is related to the power management of the device, specifically concerning the 'suspend to RAM' state or S3 state. It's an active-low signal that, when asserted (low voltage), indicates the system should enter or is in the S3 sleep state. .
definitions.SMC_BATLOW_L: What is SMC_BATLOW_L? SMC_BATLOW_L refers to a power management signal that indicates a low battery condition. The "_L" suffix suggests that this is an active-low signal, meaning that it becomes low when the battery reaches a low voltage threshold..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not turning on.
threads.message:
Hi, 

I have got <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a that is not turning on. No light on magsafe. Checked ISL62 and it seems be ok. Reistance between 17/18 and 27/28 is fine. 


PPBUS is los 1,7V

<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> is fluctuating from 16,8 to 17,1.

Checked resistance arroung ISL and also didnt find nothing wrong. 


<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> - 3.45V. 

Before checking S3 and S5 lines. Is there any idea why it is fluctuating if ISL and all componentes arround are ok?


Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not turning on.
threads.message: Update. I repassed ISL and changed it again. Now not fluctuating sometimes. Sometimes it is going up and down. PPBUS is ok. Still no green light on charger.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not turning on.
threads.message: Just saying once you fix this it will have a dead GPU...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not turning on.
threads.message:
Again GPU?:D this week is GPU deatch week. Any way to check it and be sure that GPU is dead? 

PDCIN is low anyway. It must be about 18 and it is 17V.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not turning on.
threads.message:
"It must be about 18 and it is 17V."
WOW, such a "BIIIG" difference!!!
Do you really think is that relevant???

"PPBUS is ok."
12.2V, or 12.6V?

Post <CHIP>U6900</CHIP>/01 voltages.
Did you try another DCIN board?

What about <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>?
Are you using 85W charger?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not turning on.
threads.message:
PPBUS 12.2V, is that means SMC is not working?

<CHIP>U6900</CHIP>

Pin 1 ,4,5 3.4V

<CHIP>U6901</CHIP>

Pins 1,2, 3.3 V
Pin 3 0V
Pin 4,5 3,4 V


<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> - 3.4V
<SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL> - 0V
<SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> - 0V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> - is present
<SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> - 0V


The charger is 85W and already tried know working dc in.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not turning on.
threads.message:
So <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is not OK at all.
Do NOT assume things like this in the future.

"<SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> - 0V"
Also no good.
Post <SIGNAL>SMC_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_SUS_L</SIGNAL> too.

Check continuity from <CHIP>U6900</CHIP> to DCIN central pin (Magsafe connector).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not turning on.
threads.message:
Ok, thanks about PPBUS


<SIGNAL>SMC_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_SUS_L</SIGNAL>  0V

There is no continuity from Pin 3 magsafe and <CHIP>U6900</CHIP> pin 5

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not turning on.
threads.message: P.S. Central pin of magsafe is 3 (GND)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not turning on.
threads.message:
"Pin 3 magsafe"
I do NOT mean J6900, but DCIN board...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not turning on.
threads.message: Yes, there is continuity from PIN 5 <CHIP>U6900</CHIP> to pin 3 on dc board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not turning on.
threads.message: Then try another SMC, from donor board...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not turning on.
threads.message: It was bad SMC, changed it now it boots, light is ok PPBUS is 12,6 but after apple load stack on white screen. GPU is dead. heat it up and doesnt work. So disabled dedicated GPU and now mac us rinning ok with secondary graphic card.
